TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataSourceIDConverter extends System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter

Docs.summary: Creates a user-selectable list of data source names.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter> class is a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> object that is typically referenced by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverterAttribute> attribute.
The data source names that are returned by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method are of components from the container of the specified context that are valid data sources.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.GetStandardValuesExclusive%2A> method gets a value indicating whether the returned data source names are an exclusive list of possible values. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.GetStandardValuesSupported%2A> method gets a value indicating whether the data source names are a standard set of values that can be picked from a list.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> method converts the specified object to the native type of the converter. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.CanConvertFrom%2A> method gets a value indicating whether this <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter> can convert an object in the specified source type to the native type.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.IsValidDataSource%2A> method indicates whether the specified component implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataSource> interface.

MemberSignature.Value: public DataSourceIDConverter ();

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter> class when the class is referenced by a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverterAttribute> attribute.

Docs.param: An object implementing the that provides information about a context to a type converter so that the type converter can perform a conversion.
The of the object for which conversion is being requested.
Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object in the specified source type to the native type of the converter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> method can only convert from a string, so the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.CanConvertFrom%2A> only returns `true` when `sourcetype` is a string.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.CanConvertFrom%2A> does not use the `context` parameter.

Docs.param: An object implementing the that provides information about a context to a type converter so that the type converter can perform a conversion.
A object that specifies the culture of the parameter.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified object to the native type of the converter.
Docs.returns: The parameter is returned as a string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the `value` parameter has a type of string, it is returned as a string. If `value` is `null`, an empty string ("") is returned. Otherwise, a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> is thrown.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> method does not use the `context` or `culture` parameter.

Docs.exception: is other than a string or .

override this.GetStandardValues : System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext -> System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection

Docs.param: An object implementing the that provides information about a context to a type converter so that the type converter can perform a conversion.
Docs.summary: Returns a list of the available data source names.
Docs.returns: A containing the names of the controls that implement the interface and are available for use in the given context.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method creates a list of the names of the components that are valid data sources in the container of the object that is specified by the `context` parameter. It then converts that list to a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection> object.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool GetStandardValuesExclusive (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool GetStandardValuesExclusive(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context) cil managed

override this.GetStandardValuesExclusive : System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext -> bool

Docs.param: An object implementing the that provides information about a context to a type converter so that the type converter can perform a conversion.
Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the returned data source names are an exclusive list of possible values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you derive a class from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter> class and override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method to return an exclusive list of data source names, also override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.GetStandardValuesExclusive%2A> method to return `true` when the data source name list is exclusive.
The `context` parameter is not used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.GetStandardValuesExclusive%2A>.

Docs.param: An object implementing the that provides information about a context to a type converter so that the type converter can perform a conversion.
Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this object returns a standard set of data source names that can be picked from a list.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `context` parameter is not used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.GetStandardValuesSupported%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual bool IsValidDataSource (System.ComponentModel.IComponent component);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsValidDataSource(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed
Protected Overridable Function IsValidDataSource (component As IComponent) As Boolean
protected: virtual bool IsValidDataSource(System::ComponentModel::IComponent ^ component);
abstract member IsValidDataSource : System.ComponentModel.IComponent -> bool override this.IsValidDataSource : System.ComponentModel.IComponent -> bool

Docs.param: An object that implements the interface.
Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the specified component is a valid data source.
Docs.returns: if is a valid data source; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.IsValidDataSource%2A> method considers the `component` parameter to be a valid data source if it implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataSource> interface.

block.para: The method should be overridden by controls that need to further investigate a given component to decide whether it should be returned in the list of standard values. For example, if a control works with only data sources, should return only for those components that are objects.
